title: Neco Williams set for Liverpool debut in Carabao Cup clash with Arsenal

Liverpool are set to hand a debut to youngster Neco Williams in their Carabao Cup clash with Arsenal .

Jurgen Klopp is set to make wholesale changes for the fourth round tie at Anfield on Wednesday night.

Williams, 18, is expected to start at right-back against Arsenal with Ki-Jana Hoever, who scored against MK Dons in the previous round, on international duty.

The teenager has impressed Klopp and his coaching staff at Melwood and is in line to start for the Reds.

He will be one of several youngsters set to feature against the Gunners.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

Klopp is also expected to hand a first start to summer signing Sepp van den Berg.

The 17-year-old arrived from PEC Zwolle in the summer and will start alongside Joe Gomez in central defence.

With Joel Matip sidelined, Klopp is determined to rest Virgil van Dijk and Dejan Lovren ahead of a busy run of fixtures.

Liverpool have confirmed young goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher will start in goal with Rhian Brewster and Curtis Jones also set to feature.

(Image: Getty)

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

On youngster Williams, Liverpool Under-23s boss Neil Critchley told Goal: "If he gets his opportunity, it’ll be deserved and hopefully he does himself justice.

“Neco has been in and around the Under-23s last season, and he’s definitely improved his game

“I don’t worry about his temperament, he’s been a consistent performer for us for a season-and-a-bit and he’s gone up to Melwood and the first-team staff have been really pleased with him. He’s trained there and he’s stayed there, so that can only be a good thing."
description: Neco Williams, 18, is set to be one of several Liverpool youngsters involved against Arsenal at Anfield
